programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend a locker auction at El Monte, California, where Jarrod and Brandi find their sense of charity and Barry unearths a bag that has him hitting the slopes.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton arrive at an auction separately, but a common enemy and the discovery of professional go-karts may bring them back together.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen head to auction while the employees throw an Appraisal Event. Both plans go awry, so the guys hit a yard sale. Will their findings serve up a profit?.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A famous cowboy offers his assistance to the bidders at an auction in Fort Worth, while Lesa finds a means to triumph over her rival.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: One of the buyers accidentally acquires a historically important item, while Victor gets his hands on an intriguing locked treasure chest - with no key.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz explore a warehouse belonging to country musician Mickey Gilley, and find a sign used in the movie Urban Cowboy.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: David and Jeremy hunt one of the swamp's most infamous gators, but time is running out for this season and the hunters are encountering some unexpected obstacles.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: With a gruelling winter ahead, Jamie has employed his biggest heavy rescue team yet in preparation - and when a truck carrying a huge amount of lumber crashes, the team is faced with the first big wreck of the season.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers get the chance to buy a classic 1973 pinball machine and assess the authenticity of a 1924 gold coin, considered to be the most beautiful ever produced by the US Mint.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers consider whether or not to buy a saddle used by Kevin Costner in the film Dances with Wolves, and Corey decides if he wants to make his mark in the tattoo business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has stainless steel jewellery coming to the shop, but Ashley refuses to sell it - until she is forced to do so by her cousin Karen.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Cousin Karen is ready to shake things up on the showroom floor, but Ashley is less than thrilled to have someone invading her turf.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts make surprising discoveries as they explore the ancient past for evidence of alien overseers.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: After the successes of animal cloning, experts assess when human cloning may become possible.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts ask if the bigfoot - a half-man, half-ape - is simply a figment of the imagination, or if he is being hidden from the public eye.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders consider the benefits and drawbacks of two very different neighbourhoods, and Lesa displays her ruthless side while dealing with a young buyer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A piano, a tea set and some expensive furniture are among the finds up for grabs when the buyers go to Lewisville, Texas.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When Les takes his niece Karen under his wing to help out at the jewellery counter, Ashley fails to conceal her jealousy well.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth thinks Les is stuck in the past for hand-delivering their gold to a refinery, and bets his father that his new mail order service will improve things.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers get the chance to buy a piece of American history when they assess the value of a Civil War sword. Plus, one of the country's rarest motorbikes is brought to the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers study a pocket-sized sundial that conceals an interesting secret, and Corey and Chumlee hope to get their hands on a rifle-shooting arcade game from the 1960s.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Casey and Rene buy a small, mysterious unit, and discover it contains a Wizard of Oz chess set.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod attends auctions in Mission Viejo and ends up with some unusual art on his hands. Barry's accountant tries to stop him from spending too much money.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Things get worse when the shop's landlord appears, and Ton tries to negotiate with him while Allen puts an experimental parachute to the test.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen fight back when a storeowner seems intent on preventing them from scoring new items in Santa Barbara. Plus, the guys discover a vintage wooden boat.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Dallas, where they attend several auctions in one day while facing a frantic race to keep up with the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba buy a locker full of valuable sci-fi merchandise, while Victor makes a spectacular profit on his latest purchase.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: The possibility that a wall of water on the same scale as the Indian Ocean tsunami of 2004 could strike the west coast of America, and what could be done to avert such a disaster.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Experts question who the Anti-Christ is, considering that every culture and religion on the planet believes that an evil one will usher in the end of days.

programme.title: Conspiracy Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Questioning whether technology is going too far, too fast, considering that people rely on machines for virtually every aspect of modern life.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: History's greatest geniuses have often said their ideas came from visions or hallucinations. This edition explores the notion that the forces of inspiration the ancients attributed to the gods actually emanated from an otherworldly source.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions between Karen and Ashley explode on the sales floor, so Les puts them both in the doghouse. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes on a buying spree that leaves his staff wondering what is going on. Meanwhile, Karen needs Byron's help to handle a pair of unruly piano players.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A hustler tries to make Les an offer he cannot refuse, but the Golds fight back and turn the tables on the shady customer.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley plays a prank on Seth to teach him a lesson about locking his door - but Seth evens the score with a practical joke of his own. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones try to raise money to fix their truck. Plus, they get their hands on a foosball table, Tommy gun drums and a hoard of Twinkies.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys battle it out with a fierce former employee, and a set of monster truck tires and a mystery box are their last chance to come out on top.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter: Most Wanted
programme.desc: Beth loses her battle with cancer and the family says goodbye to their matriarch. Ripped apart by grief, they rebound by going out on a hunt.

programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Cameras follow treasure hunters the Pirates Inc on high-pressure and often dangerous missions to retrieve and sell valuable items left behind by drug traffickers. In this episode, the team heads to Belize to find a plane when the pilot is jailed.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Compton, Mike buys something that Herb does not want to be anywhere near. Jarrod ends up with a new nickname while Barry and his old pal Kenny reunite.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell makes the most expensive purchase in the history of the series at an auction in Orange.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank makes a shrewd bid that leads to a big discovery and Mike falls hard for two century-old cars.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Buckinghamshire.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the auctioneers arrive in Royston, Hertfordshire where things get out of hand as Heavy D drives everyone round the auctioneering bend.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The Black Keys' frontman Dan Auerbach makes a special guest appearance as Mike plans to flip a vintage guitar.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: There are more problems for Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz as they attempt to retrieve an iconic American sports car that is so rare they have never even heard of it.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Seattle, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The hosts bid to prove that cars can be art by filling a gallery in Middlesbrough with motoring-related works, including a few creations of their own. They also resort to unusual promotional techniques to attract more visitors to their exhibition. Back on the track, Jeremy Clarkson tests British supercar the Noble M600. Jenson Button drives the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: Britain's biggest airport for air cargo undergoes a mammoth, nerve-jangling runway overhaul. Cameras also follow the emergency pilots who fly to the rescue of stranded packages.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John, Dave and Ros get an excuse to show off their knowledge of the second-hand police car market when end of service service vehicles are put up for auction.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson spares no expense when he tests the BMW X6. James May joins Margaret Calvert, one of Britain's road-sign designers, to test-drive the Vauxhall Insignia VXR, and Richard Hammond tries out a Â£340,000 Lexus supercar. Plus, musician Seasick Steve is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compete in a 1950s-style race from London to Edinburgh. On the footplate of the A1 Tornado steam train, Jeremy has to feed the boiler with a constant supply of coal, while Richard braves the saddle of a Vincent Black Shadow motorbike and James drives an old Jaguar XK120 as the trio discover what Top Gear might have been like 60 years ago. Michael Schumacher drives the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: This week Greg Davies and assistant Alex Horne engage in some role-play to assess the success of a throwing task, and Noel Fielding has a sliding session.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Bake Off presenter Mel Giedroyc, comedian Bob Mortimer, Citizen Khan star Adil Ray and Westlife singer Kian Egan are this week's guests, whose stories include licking David Bowie's cake and being ordered to leave town by the police.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show in which two teams headed by David Mitchell and Lee Mack try to hoodwink each other with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Comedian and actor Miles Jupp, chef extraordinaire Heston Blumenthal, actress Emilia Fox and funnyman Ed Byrne are this week's guests.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Host Sue Perkins and the team captains Josh Widdicombe and Richard Osman are joined by guests Danny Baker, Sara Pascoe, Deborah Meaden and Kate Williams for a festive edition of the comedy panel game, with fiendish facts about the Queen's Christmas Speech, Delia Smith's Christmas Cooking and the original Father Christmas, St Nicholas.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Guests Matt Lucas, Jerry Springer and Cariad Lloyd join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme 'noodles' in this extended episode. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.

programme.title: Comedians Giving Lectures
programme.desc: Stand-up comedians Ed Gamble, Katherine Ryan and Sindhu Vee are given the titles of real lectures and invited to give their own version. Presented by Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Joe Lycett shows no mercy to a camel, and Hugh Dennis gets a sleeping bag challenge.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave investigates whether the queue's days are numbered, and carries out his own experiment to see how the audience react when someone pushes into a queue. He also wonders if anyone pays any attention to those footprints painted on the ground at cashpoints.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: An Errand Boy by the Ear
programme.desc: Arkwright decides Granville needs toughening up and starts dragging him around the store by his ear, but the regular customers are unhappy by what they see.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright tries to improve the sale of an overstocked commodity - Jamaican Ginger cake - with incredible efficiency, and Granville's lust for power leads to disaster.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: British bombers are unable to hit their targets precisely and attack German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command.

programme.title: The Diary of Anne Frank: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Anne Frank and Eva Schloss, whose lives intertwined during the darkest of period of 20th-century history. Eva, who met Anne in Amsterdam in 1938, survived Auschwitz and here talks about her memories of the young diarist, her survival from the death camps, and how she became the step daughter of Anne's Father, Otto Frank.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Revisiting the killing of brilliant but controversial young playwright Christopher Marlowe, who was stabbed to death in a Deptford lodging house in 1593.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Arthur of Brittany: The Boy Who Should Have Been King
programme.desc: Prince Arthur of Brittany, who was subjected to the injustice of his bad uncle, John Plantagenet, the usurper of his throne and crown of England.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Portugal to meet leading experts on the Three Secrets of Fatima - a series of visions and prophecies allegedly given by the Virgin Mary to three young shepherds in 1917.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: British bombers are unable to hit their targets precisely and attack German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An abandoned railway station near a town in Spain that is home to just 500 people and a record-breaking Arctic facility that goes deep underground.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James looks at some of the advances in motoring that never caught on, revealing how the petrol engine came to dominate in the 20th century, while concepts for jet engines and steam power fell by the wayside. He also drives an amphibious car and an electric scooter, and takes a ride in the world's fastest driverless car.

programme.title: Wildest Africa
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the wildlife and landscapes of the continent, beginning with the 10,800 square miles of the Okavango Delta in Botswana - the largest inland delta in the world.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of London's Shard, revealing how it was influenced by the Milan Metro, concrete grain storage in Minnesota and a lifting mechanism in the Venice shipyards.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The story of the Ahnenerbe research institute, which was set up to provide scientific backing to Hitler's ideology, through a series of horrific experiments.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Churchill's plan to attack Germany through Italy. Although considered the simplest military solution, the Allies were to face formidable opposition, while the Americans met the Wehrmacht for the first time. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An eerie, empty country village which hides a sad secret, a mysterious tower battered by the elements and a disused railway deep beneath the streets of a city.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn explores the disused tube station Down Street in Mayfair, that played a crucial tactical role during the Second World War, and tours Rotterdam's new Centraal station with the man who designed it.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright comes up with a cunning plan and invents a Saint's day so that Granville can check the pockets of a foreign visitor who he suspects of shoplifting.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: An Errand Boy by the Ear
programme.desc: Arkwright decides Granville needs toughening up and starts dragging him around the store by his ear, but the regular customers are unhappy by what they see.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright tries to improve the sale of an overstocked commodity - Jamaican Ginger cake - with incredible efficiency, and Granville's lust for power leads to disaster.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd is unsettled when Sarah Cavendish (played by Five Daughters star Eva Birthistle), an officer of equal rank to him, joins the team to investigate the disappearance of a banker who had been struggling to cope with losing his daughter to cancer. Though Cavendish's professional skills quickly prove to be a major asset, her new colleagues discover that a failed operation from earlier in her career is continuing to haunt her, and become concerned for her welfare. Trevor Eve stars, with Sue Johnston and Tara FitzGerald.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. Jack is forced to arrest his own son Benjamin for possession of drugs, and the corpulent form of convicted rapist Peter Baxter again crosses Sam's path as she helps Ramani investigate a nurse's disappearance. Gabriel invites Sheelagh back to his place in a bid to prove that he has finally managed to forget about Kerry Young, while Yvonne is summoned to hear her fate as the inquiry into the death of Lee Chapman concludes.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Billy is rescued from a tank of caustic soda and rushed to hospital in agony while Nick returns to work just as a bombing campaign presents the team with a fresh challenge.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Old Mill Herbary at Bodmin, Cornwall, where a wide range of herbs and medicinal plants are cultivated.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah leads the charge to rescue James, whose ordeal continues when his sexuality becomes known, and puts her relationship with George at risk when a disturbing discovery forces her to reveal her darkest secret.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah reveals her horrific secret to George, and their relationship is suddenly thrown into doubt. The Christmas soiree brings out Jack's intimacy issues, and Anna publicly humiliates Andrew. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. Jack is forced to arrest his own son Benjamin for possession of drugs, and the corpulent form of convicted rapist Peter Baxter again crosses Sam's path as she helps Ramani investigate a nurse's disappearance. Gabriel invites Sheelagh back to his place in a bid to prove that he has finally managed to forget about Kerry Young, while Yvonne is summoned to hear her fate as the inquiry into the death of Lee Chapman concludes.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Helena's post-mortem reveals the error made during Nick's surgery, but Diane realises unless the surgeon comes clean, she could be the one to take the blame. Joseph's condition grows noticeably worse, and a prison inmate is admitted to the hospital after being injured in a riot. Former EastEnders actor Todd Carty guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Sean is devastated to discover the truth about Max and Tina, and Adam feels pressured to reveal his secret. Meanwhile, Patrick is amazed when a blind man inexplicably regains his sight - could it be a miracle? Medical drama, starring Gerald Kyd, Pal Aron and Ian Kelsey.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Killer - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. Peter Baxter is released on bail, even though there is evidence linking him to the disappearance of nurse Manisha Devi - but the subsequent discovery of her burnt body raises the possibility that a dreadful mistake has been made. Samantha presses ahead with the investigation, and identifies another suspect in the form of taxi driver David Russo. Unfortunately, she isn't aware that Ramani is already in the back of his cab, being driven through the streets of Sun Hill by someone who may be a killer.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Grant are on a romantic weekend and Phil and Kathy are getting to know each other better. Meanwhile Frank and Pat are visiting Diane who is heavily pregnant.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard goes green with jealousy when he sees Phil and Kathy together, Nigel confronts Nick as he tries to steal his mothers furniture and Arthur comes clean about his double life.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Angry protestors plant a fire-bomb in a chemist's shop, unaware the manager is still on the premises. Billy finally meets his mother, and Hallam fends off lovelorn student Jenny.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Lexie is annoyed when her estranged father arrives in Glenbogle, but he soon sets about charming the rest of the MacDonald clan with his tall stories. Molly and Golly pose as a married couple to buy a horse, but are forced to keep up the pretence for longer than they anticipated, and Duncan's plans to impress Jess go awry when it becomes clear they have very different tastes in interior decoration.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The locals bid an emotional farewell to Vic and Lucy, and Simon's problems continue to mount as his business crumbles and he is consumed by guilt over his fling with Evelyn. Elsewhere, a dishy gardener steals the heart of a wheelchair-bound patient, while Tom and Beth take advantage of a drunken Joe's incapacity and steal a kiss. Rural drama, starring Thomas Craig and Tony Haygarth.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The sisters face up to the realities of life with their husbands in prison, and try to explain things to Tracey's son, Garth. Classic comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene allows Boycie to buy a maximum of six cows for the farm - and is less than impressed when Elgin, Jed and Bryan turn up with a herd of 300. The vet is called out when Rocky the bull fails to take any notice of the females, and Tyler prepares to sit a local private school's entrance exam. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel is concerned that he has no pension plans, so the ever-resourceful Alistair comes up with an ingenious idea - to sell the country house. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo's nephew is getting married, and while the groom's uncle considers having a bath to mark the occasion, Foggy fears disaster will befall the happy couple.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge presides over the case of a man who killed a paedophile, an act that Jo defends by arguing it protected further victims from abuse. Meanwhile, she meets the real father of the boy she is trying to adopt, and begins seeing him socially - sending Deed into a fit of jealous rage. Martin Shaw and Jenny Seagrove star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reinvestigates the murder of a man found in an alleyway seven years previously when he is identified on a website covering unexplained disappearances. The victim is named by a woman whose husband hired him six months before his death, but neither of them had thought anything of it when their employee went missing - and seem to know little about him. Meanwhile, Brian and Gerry are distracted by looming job cuts and fear that Ucos could be downsized. With Robert Daws and Claudie Blakley.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A woman who went missing from a care home in 1986 is found murdered in a burnt-out car, and the team discovers she had recently abducted a teenage girl herself. As the investigation continues, both cases appear to be linked to an urban myth about a character known as the Bag Man - an eyeless villain who kidnaps children. With Eva Birthistle, Tara FitzGerald and Wil Johnson.

programme.title: Beat the Chasers
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a spin-off from The Chase in which contestants take on two, three, four or all five of the quiz's resident experts Mark Labbett, Anne Hegerty, Paul Sinha, Jenny Ryan and Shaun Wallace at once. Members of the audience are called out to face five multiple choice questions, with the chance to bank up to Â£5,000, but if they get the first question wrong they are out. Next, contestants are given the option of playing between two and all five Chasers for increasing amounts of money, but with a decreasing time advantage against them..

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster, including Adam Page, Chris Jericho, Cody and Jon Moxley.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: 1000 Heartbeats
programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win Â£25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they mine marble for Washington's monuments, how do they make Tabasco Sauce, and how do they produce storm proof umbrellas?.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China gets to work transforming an old Mazda MX5, removing the leaking roof, rusty wings and seats.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The air filter, chassis brace and wheels of the Mazda MX5 are fixed, and the new roof is fitted before Mike Brewer takes the completed car for a test drive.

programme.title: World's Greatest Motorcycle Rides
programme.desc: The most famous road race in the world - the Isle of Man TT, which follows a course only 37 miles long.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Sr is left wondering what went wrong when his son secures a commission from a client, and Jason invites the feuding duo to his wedding.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: A search for the ultimate giants of engineering genius, beginning with the world's best aircraft, including the Eurofighter Typhoon, the Antonov 225 and the Airbus A380

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe harvests blueberries in Maine, before taking part in a baking contest. He also discovers if it is possible to make jelly beans taste like his work boots.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at where materials come from and how manufacturing processes have developed over the years, featuring detachable IndyCar steering wheels, mixed salad and wind turbines.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope, looking at how blast doors, lipstick, artificial palm trees and brass plaques are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at the development of the finest oyster knives, and the lights transforming sport worldwide. Plus, how diamonds grown in a greenhouse are behind a gemstone revolution.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland head to the Midlands to look at a Swedish classic - the Volvo Amazon. When Paul falls for an early Toyota MR2, he seeks a way to convince Drew it will turn a profit.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: In this two-hour special, two new skippers join the fleet to take on the treacherous Bering Sea, and invade the Wizard's crab grounds.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer bags a bargain example of one of his dream cars - a Ford Fiesta XR2 - but there is only Â£1,000 to spend on repairs.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to America in search of a Dodge Charger for expert mechanic Edd China to restore, but the hefty price tag attached to such a famous car could be a problem if the pair are to succeed in selling it on at a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne goes after a 500hp 1952 Allard J2X and Lamborghini Miura. While both owners are eager to sell, it looks like they might be getting cold feet.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini uncovers a rare 1938 Bugatti Type 57C Atalante Coupe from a secluded garage.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to make a bicycle which can fold up to a tenth the size of a regular bike. Plus, the process behind the making of a Borsalino hat worn by Indiana Jones.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to make the Fender Stratocaster electric guitar, and a look at the way Swedish fermented cod roe Kalles caviar is made.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: The crew takes advantage of a break in the weather to seize its share of the trade, but the tight time line could force members to take dangerous risks.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Empty crab pots create tension among the fleet, as unrewarding fishing in the Bering Sea whittles away the crews' profit and affects morale.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton takes Hus on an Italian road-trip. From Venice to Lake Garda, the pair meet up with dealers whose objects tell the story of Italy's role in the Second World War.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Belgium on a continental buying adventure. He visits the flea market in Tongeren and meets a renowned dealer who lives in a huge chateau.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: French polisher Alex restores a 1930s rocking horse. Sculptor Nick rescues a mid-century piece and upholsterer Craig attempts to restore a classic Victorian chair.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China gets to work transforming an old Mazda MX5, removing the leaking roof, rusty wings and seats.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The air filter, chassis brace and wheels of the Mazda MX5 are fixed, and the new roof is fitted before Mike Brewer takes the completed car for a test drive.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Drew Pritchard finds a stunning collection of antique cutler's stools. Later, he heads to Leeds where he finds some rare streetlights at a heritage railway and museum.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to an antiques shop in Edinburgh on a hunt for new stock, and on an expedition to a 750-year-old house, he discovers an item that takes him out of his comfort zone.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: The M4 is closed so diggers can demolish a bridge. Accidents pile up as scrapped engines in scrap vans are raced into oblivion in a final demolition derby.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team tackle a badly water-damaged rosewood table, give a much-loved panda bear a makeover and restore a vintage toy steamboat.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Tales from the Black Stuff/Silk/In the Can
programme.desc: How Irish stout is made, and how silkworms are used to create gunpowder bags and clothes. Plus, the method of putting soup into cans without spilling.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technology used to dive for natural sponges, and how taxi drivers know their way to so many destinations.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of an undercover operation, codenamed 'Safe Bet', which targeted corrupt police officers and their connections with the Chicago Mafia.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Plants help provide oxygen and nutrients, but in a criminal investigation, they can also mark the time and location of a person's death.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of millionaire entrepreneur Rick Chance, who was brutally gunned down in a hotel room. To catch the killer, detectives turned to surveillance video for help.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Kelly Eckart, an 18-year-old who disappeared after finishing her shift at an Indiana hardware store in September 1997. Her car was discovered abandoned by the side of the road still running, and four days later her partially naked body was found in a ravine. Workman Michael Overstreet was eventually convicted of the crime after eyewitnesses reported seeing him in the area and DNA evidence provided a solid link.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How the disappearance of a young woman in a small community led to a massive media campaign and nationwide hunt for a sadistic serial killer.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A case of neglect turns into a stand-off when investigators discover horses with shocking injuries. Plus, the team responds to a call to save a trapped dog.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Two boxer puppies are found wandering the streets, and Dr Chris Brown tries to save one after it is hit by a car and begins to cough up blood.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown and the team hope a miniature horse suffering from dwarfism disease will survive another major operation.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sonya wants an expensive look on a budget, while Candice is getting married for a second time and seeks a dress to represent who she is now.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Bridesmaids are told they just need to show up to their fitting, but when the bride is unable to decide on a colour her party begin to get fed up.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A tantrum erupts after a bride overlooks her daughter for her future stepdaughter, making the salon begin to feel like a nursery school.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown meets Harriet, a bearded dragon with a strange lump on its leg, as he continues to work at Kyabram Vet Clinic in Victoria.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A Staffordshire bull terrier undergoes radical new surgery to try to fix a gaping hole in its mouth. Plus, Dr Chris Brown attempts to relieve lifeguards of a sunbathing snake.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A police homicide inquiry uncovers seven emaciated dogs in the backyard of a house. Plus, investigators have to catch scores of starving chickens.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: When a cat is brought to the Houston SPCA suffering from severe burns, the case leads to the animal's 14-year-old owner and a bottle of lighter fuel.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientists use forensic evidence to try to uncover the identity of the killer of a young mother, who was stabbed in her kitchen, and an elderly couple who were shot dead.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of avid scuba diver Ben McDaniel, who in August 2010, slipped beneath the clear waters of Vortex Spring, Florida, intent on making a name for himself in the extreme world of cave diving. However, he was never seen again. The caves are known to have claimed the lives of other divers, but Ben's body was never recovered.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 18-year-old Zebb Quinn, who went missing in January 2000 shortly after completing his shift at a supermarket in Asheville, North Carolina.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Poisons can be deadly and are often almost impossible to detect. Forensic experts show how they can solve these mysterious deaths.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: A former professional cheerleader has a clear vision of how she wants her wedding day to look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: Patti-Anne is planning her wedding in the Bahamas, where she wants to look like a mermaid, but her worst nightmare comes true when the wrong dress arrives.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: The Big Day
programme.desc: An acrobat chooses a dress for his wife of 15 years as they prepare to renew their vows - but his choice may not be to her liking.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: An expensive industrial drawer unit and an old cotton wheel are among the items Mark Franks helps three collectors pick up in the commune of Carpentras in the south of France.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road in Sheffield, Dan Hatfield and his team try to do a deal on a tank, and one customer wants Â£10,000 for his gold - but can Dan help him reach his target? At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in south-east London, boss Nathan Finch is bewitched by some valuable paintings, and wants to do a deal on some stunning earrings that could kick-start a dream business.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Steven's addictions spiral and a risky decision is needed to save his life. As brother Justin accepts help, Dr Now tries to find the root of their issues.

programme.title: 1000lb Sisters
programme.desc: After a stressful first month of dieting, the sisters head back to Atlanta for a check in with Dr Procter. The results force Amy to make a difficult decision.

programme.title: My Feet Are Killing Me
programme.desc: A man with an extremely rare disease has the largest feet Dr Schaeffer has ever seen. Plus, an athlete with two different-sized feet presents a difficult surgery.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The bloodiest gun battle in the FBI's history, which occurred on April 11, 1986, when agents attempted to apprehend two suspects responsible for a prolonged crime spree.
